title: For Sale:  Thompson Center SB .56 (Renegade)
postcontent:
Up for sale is a quite rare, twin trigger Thompson Center .56 cal Smooth bore. Quite the neat gun in that it's both a black powder shotgun as well as shoots balls on a 1" Renegade frame. Specifically made for New England hunters who were not allowed to use rifled barrels during black powder season in the late 70's. This gun is quite rare and it's estimated that only about 2000 or so were made. Great gun from everything from deer with balls out to 100 yards, and depending on shot and powder good for small game to turkey.

These guns are becoming quite collectible as they're getting harder and harder to get. They're also very sought after by people shooting in black powder matches and are also compatible with any aftermarket 1" barrel (green mountain etc) meaning you can buy a nice rifled barrel for it to go along with the smooth bore, though this is arguably one of the best 26" barrels ever made. . Gun is used, but in great condition, it was my first black powder gun and carried by me and my father before me (who bought it new) and has taken quite a few deer between the two of us so it has minor dings from being in the deer woods but overall nice and still a great shooter. 

$350.00 or Best Offer. All reasonable offers will be considered. Thanks a lot and have a great day.

The true value of this rifle is all in the action. This rifle will be great for someone who wants to own a piece of U.S. history and do some serious long-range shooting/medium-game hunting as well, or someone who wants to build a BADASS custom rifle on one of the greatest actions ever manufactured!
